intro: Galium × viciosorum, commonly known as common wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each consisting of three heart-shaped leaflets, and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Galium × viciosorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local wildlife.
